titlestmt.titleproper: Asian Art and Architecture Slide Collection
Asian Art and Architecture Slide Collection
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Christina Corrigan

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:21

did.unittitle: Asian Art and Architecture Slide Collection
did.abstract: Collection of 2,051 slides of painting, sculpture, architecture, and decorative arts, from Cambodia, Indonesia, India, Japan, Laos, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Vietnam requested by Professor Mimi Hall Yiengpruksawan ca. 2000-2005. Some basic identifying information given in English on slide mounts or guide cards.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Further use of this material may be subject to the copyright laws of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms or conditions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Asian Art and Architecture Slide Collection, Arts Library, Yale University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of 2,051 slides of painting, sculpture, architecture, and decorative arts, from Cambodia, Indonesia, India, Japan, Laos, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Vietnam requested by Professor Mimi Hall Yiengpruksawan ca. 2000-2005. Some basic identifying information given in English on slide mounts or guide cards.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized by region (East Asia, South and Southeast Asia) and further subdivided by country and then medium.

did.unittitle: Kam, Ramayana in the Arts of Asia, 2000 (27 slides)
Kerlogue, Arts of Southeast Asia, 2004 (4 slides)
Garnier, Khmer Art in Reserve, 1997 (16 slides)
Guillon, Musée de Sculpture Cam de Dà Nang, 2001 (5 slides)
Insider's Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia (2 slides)
Jessup, Court Arts of Indonesia, 1990 (26 slides)
Guillon, Hindu Buddhist Art of Vietnam, 2001 (29 slides)
Prasart Museum: Treasures of Thailand, 1990 (?) (17 slides)
